info.description: Rest API for accessing the APOLLO catalog
info.title: APOLLO Catalog and Data Management API

license.name: 2017 Intergraph Corporation. All rights reserved. Hexagon Geospatial is part of Intergraph Corporation

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description: Get and manage jobs created by other APIs

get.description: Catalog items can be filtered by various query parameters. By default a brief summary of each catalog item is returned.
Returns a specific catalog item. By default the full catalog item is returned.

delete.description: Deleting a non-aggregate will delete that item only. Deleting an aggregate will perform a cascading delete and any contained aggregates and items will also be deleted.  DELETE /content/catalog/items/{itemId} will redirect here.

patch.description: Updates property values on a specific catalog item.

get.description: Returns a list of attachments for the specified catalog item.

post.description: Adds an attachment reference to the catalog item. The attachment is represented by path to a file, name for attachment, and the mimeType of the file.

201.description: Success, with the URL of the created attachment in the response Location header, if the property was successfully created.

delete.description: Deletes an attachment reference from a specific catalog item.

204.description: Successfully deleted the attachment from catalog item.

get.description: Returns the value of the property for a specific catalog item.

post.description: Create a new property, or update an existing property, of a specific catalog item.

201.description: Success, with the URL of the created property in the response Location header, if the property was successfully created.

delete.description: Deletes a property by name from a specific catalog item .

get.description: Returns a concept that classifies a specific catalog item.

post.description: Adds a new concept type that classifies a catalog item.

201.description: Success if concept was successfully created.

delete.description: Deletes a concept type that classifies a catalog item.

get.summary: Get all classification object type items.
get.description: Returns list of objects classified by a specific concept item.

post.description: Adds a new object to classify a given concept type item.

201.description: Success if item was successfully created.

delete.summary: Delete a classification object type item.
delete.description: Deletes an object classified by a given concept item.

get.description: Gets rights information for a specific catalog item.

put.summary: Add or update rights for catalog item.
put.description: Creates or modifies the existing the rights for a specific catalog item.

get.description: Gets a summary of rights for the current user for a specific catalog item.

delete.description: Deletes a principal's rights for a catalog item.

get.description: Returns list of aggregate catalog items. Catalog aggregates can be filtered using the various query parameters. By default a brief summary for each folder is returned.

post.description: Adds an aggregate catalog item with minimum properties. Returns new aggregate id in Location header.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Creates an aggregate with minimum properties.

get.description: Returns a specific aggregate catalog item. By default, this the full aggregate definition is returned.

patch.description: Updates property values on a specific aggregate catalog item.

get.description: Returns all image dataset catalog items. Catalog items can by filtered using various query parameters. By default, a brief summary for each catalog item is returned.

post.description: Adds a image dataset catalog item.

201.description: Success, with the URL of the created resource in the response Location header, if the resource was successfully created.

get.description: Returns an image dataset by specific catalog item. By default, the full catalog item is returned.

patch.description: Updates property values on a specific catalog image dataset.

get.description: Returns a list of all vector feature dataset catalog items. Catalog items can be filtered using various query parameters. By default, a brief summary of the catalog items is returned.

post.description: Adds a vector dataset catalog item.

201.description: Success, with the URL of the created resource in the response Location header, if the resource was successfully created.

get.description: Gets a specific vector feature dataset catalog item. By default, the full catalog item is returned.

patch.description: Update property values on a specific vector feature dataset.

get.description: Returns list of all point cloud dataset catalog items. Catalog items can be filtered using the various query parameters. By default, a brief summary of each catalog item is returned.

post.description: Adds a new point cloud dataset catalog item.

201.description: Success, with the URL of the created resource in the response Location header, if the resource was successfully created.

get.description: Returns a specific point cloud dataset catalog item. By default, the full catalog item is returned.

patch.description: Update property values on a specific point cloud dataset.

get.description: Returns list of all business dataset catalog items. Catalog items can be filtered using various query parameters. By default, a brief summary of each catalog item is returned.

post.description: Adds a new business dataset catalog item

201.description: Success, with the URL of the created resource in the response Location header, if the resource was successfully created.

get.description: Returns a specific business dataset catalog item. By default, the full catalog item is returned.

patch.description: Update property values on a specific business dataset catalog item.

get.description: Returns list of all video dataset catalog items. Catalog items can be filtered using various query parameters. By default, a brief summary of each catalog item is returned.

post.description: Adds a new video dataset catalog item.

201.description: Success, with the URL of the created resource in the response Location header, if the resource was successfully created.

get.description: Returns a specific video dataset catalog item. By default, the full catalog item is returned.

patch.description: Update property values on a specific video dataset catalog item.

post.description: Creates job to clip data from catalog, package clipped data in zip file, and email download enabled link
Creates job to find recognized data types on file system or in database and add to the APOLLO catalog
Creates a dropbox folder for monitoring and dynamically adds files to the APOLLO catalog

delete.description: Removes monitoring from a dropbox folder and deletes the associated configuration files

post.summary: Delete multiple aggregates or catalog items
post.description: Create a job that will delete one or more aggregate or catalog items. Deleting a non-aggregate will delete that item only. Deleting an aggregate will perform a cascading delete and any contained aggregates and items will also be deleted
Create a job that will update single or bulk metadata items from the APOLLO catalog attachment
Create a job that will move catalog items to a different folder and the restore folders operation is called on the modified folders after the move is complete.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: List of catalog item identifier(s) and new parent folder id

get.summary: Get job ids of all jobs
get.description: Returns list of all current running job ids
Returns status for the specific job

delete.description: Deletes a current running job by id

put.description: Cancels a current running job by id

post.description: Creates a job that will generate a pyramid file. The specified catalog item will be updated with pyramid information. Multiple catalog item ids may be specified.
Creates a job that adds existing pyramid file for specified catalog item. The catalog item will be updated with pyramid information. The catalog item specified should be an aggregate.

delete.description: Deletes pyramid information or specified catalog item id. The catalog item id may be either an aggregate or dataset item. The local pyramid file is left on server.

parameters.name: deleteLocalFile
parameters.description: Remove local pyramid file from the server

post.description: Creates a job that will generate a thumbnail file. The specified catalog item will be updated with thumbnail information. Multiple catalog item ids may be specified.

get.description: Return list of all process dataset catalog items
Returns a list of all contact type catalog items
Returns a specific contact type catalog item. By default, the full catalog item is returned.

delete.description: Deletes a specific contact type catalog item

get.description: Returns a list of all OGC service catalog items. OGC Service items can be filtered by various query parameters. By default a brief summary of each service item is returned.

post.description: Harvests existing OGC service by service URL and returns the new OGC service catalog reference in the location header.

parameters.name: basicauth
parameters.description: Basic authentication encoded value only. Do not prefix encoding with the word 'basic'.

parameters.name: reharvest
parameters.description: Flag to indicate whether existing service resource should be updated or not.

200.description: Success. Use GET with keywords=ServiceName to get new catalog item information.

get.description: Returns an OGC service catalog item. By default, the full catalog item is returned.

delete.description: Deletes a specific OGC service catalog item

post.description: Adds a new legacy vector service based on a vector provider type specified in payload.

get.summary: Get all legacy vector service names
get.description: Returns a list of unique names for the existing legacy vector services.
Returns an existing legacy vector service information by its unique name.

delete.description: Deletes a specific legacy vector service catalog item by its unique name

patch.description: Updates a specific legacy vector service catalog item by its unique name

post.description: Adds a new legacy context service based on a context provider type specified in payload

get.summary: Get all legacy context service names
get.description: Returns a list of unique names for the existing legacy context services
Returns an existing legacy context service information by its unique name

delete.description: Deletes a specific legacy context service catalog item by its unique name

id.description: Catalog item id. It may have optional catalog id: [{catalog-id}_]{item-id}.

ids.description: Array of catalog item ids. They may have optional catalog id: [{catalog-id}_]{item-id}.

type.description:
Type code defined as follows:
- ```'1' = string ```
- ```'2' = 32 bit integer ```
- ```'3' = double ```
- ```'4' = 64-bit integer ```
- ```'5' = float ```
- ```'6' = date (ISO-8601 format) ```

value.description: String representation of the property value

CatalogAttribute.description: The catalog property is a name and value pair. JSON format is 'propertyName' : 'propertyValue'

AnyName.description: Name value pair where AnyName is any property name followed by the value

_encodingTime.description: Time in milliseconds that it took to encode the response

totalAvailableResults.description: Total number of catalog items available

QueryContext.description: Specific context of the query that was made

id.description: Unique id for the catalog item

parentId.description: Id of the parent catalog folder

CatalogItem.description: Catalog item definition (might be a partial definition depending on the profile specified)

maxresults.description: The maximum number of catalog items to return

first.description: Filter the results starting at this index between 0 and the total number of catalog items.

orderby.description: Return the catalog items ordered according to the given catalog property name. The property must be a valid property for the type of catalog item being queried. Use ```asc``` for ascending and ```desc``` for descending

profile.description: Profile determines the amount of detail that is returned with each catalog item

AdvancedSearchCriteria.description: Criteria used for advanced searches of the catalog

class.description:
Possible entity class names.  Possible values include:
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.ResourceAggregate```
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.imagery.ImageReference```
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.vector.VectorReference```
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.pointcloud.PointCloudResource```
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.GenericItem```
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.video.VideoResource```

SearchTemplate.description: Catalog item template used for advanced search

_op.description:
- ```eq``` | Matches the catalog item if the given property's value equals ```value```.
- ```gt``` | Matches the catalog item if the given property's value is greater than ```value```.
- ```ge``` | Matches the catalog item if the given property's value is greater than or equal to ```value```.
- ```lt``` | Matches the catalog item if the given property's value is less than ```value```.
- ```le``` | Matches the catalog item if the given property's value is less than or equal to ```value```

lo.description: Defines the lo value when using the interval operator

hi.description: Defines the high value when using the interval operator

geom.description: Defines the geometry used for the spatial operators intersect, contains, within

QueryParameters.description: Query parameters used in the request

_encodingTime.description: Time in milliseconds that it took to encode the response
Time in milliseconds that it took to encode the response

message.description: Describes error in more detail related to field

reader.description: Whether the current principal has read privilege for this catalog item.

updater.description: Whether the current principal has update privilege for this catalog item.

deleter.description: Whether the current principal has delete privilege for this catalog item.

executer.description: Whether the current principal has execute privilege for this catalog item.

manager.description: Whether the current principal has management privilege for this catalog item.

reader.description: Whether the current user has read privilege for this catalog item.

updater.description: Whether the current user has update privilege for this catalog item.

deleter.description: Whether the current user has delete privilege for this catalog item.

executer.description: Whether the current user has execute privilege for this catalog item.

manager.description: Whether the current user has management privilege for this catalog item.

itemIsShared.description: Whether the catalog item is shared.

type.description:
Type code defined as follows:
- ```'1' = string ```
- ```'2' = 32 bit integer ```
- ```'3' = double ```
- ```'4' = 64-bit integer ```
- ```'5' = float ```
- ```'6' = date (ISO-8601 format) ```

value.description: String representation of the property value.

newname.description: The new name to be given to the property.

BulkProperty.description: Definition of a property which is to be added, modified or renamed. Provide type and value in order to add or modify the property or provide newname in order to rename the property.

ids.description: The ids of catalog items that are to be locked. They may have optional catalog id: [{catalog-id}_]{item-id}.

lockId.description: The id of the lock set.

LockSpecification.description: Specification of items to be locked as a set.

lockId.description: The id of the lock set.

ids.description: The ids of catalog items that are to be updated. They may have optional catalog id: [{catalog-id}_]{item-id}.

patch.description: A list of properties that are to be given a new value for each given catalog item, and their new values.

rightsput.description: A list of security principals (users and roles) and acc that are to be given access to the given catalog items or whose access rights are to be modified. If adding a new principal, missing rights will be denied. If modifying an existing principal, missing rights will not be changed.

rightsdelete.description: The names of security principals whose access rights to the given catalog items are to be revoked.

items.description: The name of a security principal -- either a user or a role.

propertiesput.description: A list of catalog item properties that are to be added to each given catalog item.

propertiesdelete.description: The names of catalog item properties that are to be deleted from the properties collection of each given catalog item.

items.description: The name of a catalog item property.

UpdateSet.description: A list of catalog items that are to be updated and the set of operations that are to be applied to all of them.

ScaleRangeDefinition.description: Provides ability to specify the scales a principal can view the data, or more simply, how detailed an image the principal will be able to see

upperBound.description: Upper bound scale limit for a principal

lowerBound.description: Upper bound scale limit for a principal

SpatialRangeDefinition.description: Providers ability to restrict the access of the principal to the data based on specified areas

srs.description: Spatial reference system of the specific area defined

areaAsString.description: Specific area defined that applies to principal's access. Enter the points in the following format: X1,Y1 X2,Y2 X3,Y3 ... Xn,Yn

inclusive.description: If true, a principal can access only the specific area. If false, principal can access everything except the specific area

PermissionsDefinition.description: Provides ability to specify what the selected principal will be allowed to do with the data discovered during the crawl

read.description: Ability to view the data in Apollo catalog

update.description: Ability to alter the data in Apollo catalog

delete.description: Ability to remove the entry of the data from the Apollo catalog

manage.description: Ability to define security settings for other principals

execute.description: Ability to execute operations on the Apollo catalog

path.description: A URI reference to point to attachment. Examples: file:///c:/TEMP/file.xml, http://example.org/resource.txt

mimeType.description: A MIME type is a label used to identify a type of data. Example: 'text/html'

name.description: Unique name for the service provider

title.description: Optional. A descriptive title for the service provider

abstract.description: Optional. A brief description of the service provider

keywords.description: Optional. A comma-separated list of words that help to describe the service provider. These words can be used to help the system return this service provider in response to relevant searches.

registerServiceInCatalog.description: Registers the service provider in Apollo catalog so that it appears in searches of the catalog

fileLocation.description: This field represents a specific file or a directory as the data source

uploadFilesToServer.description: If this field is True,the files in the fileLocation property will be copied to the server; if False, files will be referenced from their current location

name.description: Unique name for the service provider

title.description: Optional. A descriptive title for the service provider

abstract.description: Optional. A brief description of the service provider

keywords.description: Optional. A comma-separated list of words that help to describe the service provider. These words can be used to help the system return this service provider in response to relevant searches

indexData.description: Creates RTree files beside the shapefiles for optimized access

generateTypesAndMappings.description: Generate the types and mappings files needed to map vector data into features in a WFS

registerServiceInCatalog.description: Optional. Registers the service provider in Apollo catalog so that it appears in searches of the catalog

databaseTablePattern.description: Used to filter the layers that will be added to the web service.  % is the default and implies you will be adding all available datasets or layers into the service

databaseSchema.description: Provides ability to choose which database schema to use, if your input data source is a database

autoDetectGeometryTypes.description: Enables scan of the source data to determine the geometry type(s) used

fileLocation.description: This field represents a specific file or a directory as the data source. This field is not required if using database as the data source.

uploadFilesToServer.description: If this field is True,the files in the fileLocation property will be copied to the server; if False, files will be referenced from their current location.

spatialReferenceSystem.description: Shape file spatial reference system. Example: 'EPSG:4326'

databaseHost.description: Host machine of database source. Not required if using fileLocation

databasePort.description: Port number of host machine of database source. Not required if using fileLocation

databaseUser.description: User name to login into database source. Not required if using fileLocation

databasePassword.description: Password to login into database source. Not required if using fileLocation

databaseName.description: Name to login into database source. Not required if using fileLocation

databaseSid.description: (Oracle only) SID for database source. Not required if using fileLocation

databaseServiceName.description: ServiceName for database source. Not required if using fileLocation

databaseInstance.description: (SQL Server only)Instance name for database source. Not required if using fileLocation

enableWFS.description: Enable/disable the WFS interface. The default value is true to enable.

enableWMS.description: Enable/disable the WMS interface. The default value is true to enable.

emailAddress.description: Email notifications of the provisioning job will be sent

deleteJobIfComplete.description: Provides ability to keep a job even it is completed successfully. Review job at jobs endpoint using jobId

ignoreWarnings.description: Provides ability to ignore validation warnings. An exception will be ignored if validation fails and value is true

DropBoxParametersDefinition.description: A representation of a drop box input parameters for monitoring incoming datasets

sourceDirectory.description: The full path of the drop box source/input directory

targetDirectory.description: The full path of the drop box target/output. NOTE: The target directory set for the drop box cannot be reparented.

parentId.description: Aggregate catalog id to be the parent of the crawled datasets

footprintAsExtent.description: If true, footprints will be generated identical to the spatial extent of the aggregate or dataset if true; however, if false, the footprints will only contain the valid data found within the aggregate or dataset

generatePyramids.description: Enables generation of pyramids for aggregates, datasets, both or none

generateThumbnails.description: Enables generation of thumbnails for aggregates, datasets, both or none

FilesCrawl.description: A representation of a files crawl input parameters

replicateDirectory.description: If true, any subdirectory found under the 'directory' to crawl will be created as an aggregate and will be the parent aggregate for any datasets it contains

directory.description: The directory to search. Leave as empty string if using 'files' option

files.description: A list of specific files to crawl into the 'parentId' aggregate. Leave as empty [] if using 'directory' option

fileExtensions.description: An example of supported file extensions for decoding but not all are included. Leave empty [] if you want to include all supported extensions

FileExtensionDefinition.description: An example of file extension types;however,not a complete list

DatabaseCrawl.description: A representation of a database crawl input parameters

server.description: Name of the server that hosts the database

port.description: TCP port used for the connection

username.description: Name of the database user for the connection

queryTimeout.description: The number of seconds to wait before canceling long-running queries. The default value is 0, which means no timeout is imposed

additionalInfo.description: Additional connection parameters that will be appended to the generated connection string. The value must be formatted correctly according to the requirements of the target database systems connection string. This parameter is optional and may be left blank

connectionName.description: The name to give to this connection when it is saved in the catalog. The connection name must be unique. A new Aggregate having the same name as the connection will be created to contain the datasets from the crawl.

databaseName.description: (PostGIS and SQL Server only)  The name of the database to which to connect

databaseInstance.description: (SQL Server only)  The name of the database instance

srs.description: The SRS to use for the data in the database if the data does not specify one explicitly

sid.description: (Oracle only)  System ID of the Oracle database instance. Leave blank if using a Service Name

serviceName.description: (Oracle only)  The service name of the Oracle database. Leave blank if using a SID

tableOrViewPattern.description: The table name pattern will be used to filter the names of tables and views to crawl

parentId.description: Aggregate catalog id to be the parent of the crawled datasets

footprintAsExtent.description: If true, footprints will be generated identical to the spatial extent of the aggregate or dataset if true; however, if false, the footprints will only contain the valid data found within the aggregate or dataset

generatePyramids.description: Enables generation of pyramids for aggregates, datasets, both or none

generateThumbnails.description: Enables generation of thumbnails for aggregates, datasets, both or none

DeleteJobParameters.description: A representation of input parameters to remove catalog items and any associated items from the Apollo catalog

ids.description: List of comma delimited catalog ids to remove from the Apollo catalog

deleteJobIfComplete.description: Provides ability to keep a job even it is completed successfully. Review job at jobs endpoint using jobId

MetadataUpdateJobParameters.description: A representation of input parameters that updates ISO metadata for a list of catalog items

ids.description: List of comma delimited catalog item ids

forAggregates.description: Update ISO metadata for catalog aggregates

forDatasets.description: Update ISO metadata for catalog items

deleteJobIfComplete.description: Provides ability to keep a job even it is completed successfully. Review job at jobs endpoint using jobId.

MoveJobParameters.description: A representation of input parameters to move catalog items to a new parent folder

ids.description: List of comma delimited catalog item ids

newParentFolderId.description: Target parent id for the moved catalog items

deleteJobIfComplete.description: Provides ability to keep a job even it is completed successfully. Review job at jobs endpoint using jobId.

restoreFolderProperties.description: Optional property. Restores modified folders based on the specified properties

applyToChildren.description: Starting with first folder below root, if true, extents are restored and footprint generated for all children of the folder. If false, only the immediate parent will have extents restored and footprint generated.

restorePyramids.description: If true, the generate pyramids task will be executed for the modified folders

restoreThumbnails.description: If true, the generate thumbnails task will be executed for the modified folders

restoreISOFiles.description: If true, generate ISO metadata task will be executed for the modified folders

restoreFootprints.description: The generate footprint task will be executed for the modified folders using either extent or activeArea.The default is extent

progress.description: Percentage of completion for a job

state.description: Internal state of job given in pre-defined type strings

startTime.description: The start time of a job

endTime.description: The end time of a job

MetadataParserSettings.description: Specify any metadata parsers to detect the metadata when APOLLO registers the data in the catalog

executionStrategy.description: If strategy is 'firstSucess, do not attempt to run any more metadata parsers once one of the metadata parser runs successfully.

SecuritySettingsDefinition.description: Provides ability to add or remove principals, define allowed operations per principal, and specify allowed spatial range view per principal

principalName.description: A user or role name to assign permissions

PyramidAddExistingParameters.description: Provides the ability to attach pyramid layer files to an aggregate in the Apollo catalog

aggregateId.description: Parent catalog item id that contains the image to add pyramids

filePath.description: The path of the pyramid layer file to add

decimationFactor.description: The number of pixels in a layer that will be represented by one pixel in the next pyramid layer. The most common decimation factor is two, which means that a 2x2 square of pixels will be represented in the next layer

deleteJobIfComplete.description: Provides ability to keep a job even it is completed successfully. Review job at jobs endpoint using jobId.

PyramidDeleteExistingParameters.description: Provides the ability to delete pyramid layers for data after it has been registered in the catalog

catalogItemId.description: The parent catalog item containing the pyramid to delete

deleteLocalFile.description: If true, deletes the pyramid file as well as disassociates it from the aggregate. If false,keeps the pyramid file even though it is no longer associated with the aggregate

deleteJobIfComplete.description: Provides ability to keep a job even it is completed successfully. Review job at jobs endpoint using jobId.

PyramidJobParameters.description: Properties to create pyramid layers for data after it has been registered in the catalog

applyToChildAggregates.description: Generate pyramids for the specified aggregate, all of the datasets directly inside of it, and all of the child datasets and aggregates that are nested inside of it

applyToChildDatasets.description: Generate pyramids for datasets directly inside the aggregate

ids.description: List of comma delimited catalog item ids

deleteJobIfComplete.description: Provides ability to keep a job even it is completed successfully. Review job at jobs endpoint using jobId.

RecurringJob.description: Crawl will run automatically at a specific interval and time

startDateTime.description: A string with ISO8601 datetime format

deleteJobIfComplete.description: Provides ability to keep a job even it is completed successfully. Review job at jobs endpoint using jobId.

ThumbnailJobParameters.description: A representation of generate thumbnails input parameters

replaceExisting.description: If true, update the thumbnail when a search produces new data

applyToChildren.description: If true, generate thumbnail for selected aggregate and its children

ids.description: List of comma delimited catalog item ids

DownloadServices.description: Provides ability to enable/disable all download services (CZS and WCS) for aggregates or datasets

czsEnabled.description: Makes the data discovered during the crawl available to the Clip-Zip-Ship service
Makes the data discovered during the crawl available to the Clip-Zip-Ship service

wcsEnabled.description: Makes the data discovered during the crawl available to a Web Coverage Service (WCS)

ViewServiceSettings.description: Provides ability to enable/disable all viewing services (WMS, WMTS, GeoServices, ECWP and JPIP) for aggregates or datasets

wmtsEnabled.description: Makes the data discovered during the crawl available to a Web Map Tile Service (WMTS)

wmsEnabled.description: Makes the data discovered during the crawl available to a Web Map Service (WMS)

wmtsEnabled.description: Makes the data discovered during the crawl available to a Web Map Tile Service (WMTS)

geoservicesEnabled.description: Makes data discovered during the crawl available to GeoServices

ecwpEnabled.description: Makes the data discovered during the crawl available to an ECWP service

jpipEnabled.description: Makes the data discovered during the crawl available to a JPIP service

title.description: Optional. A service Title (or label) in the <Service> section of the capabilities document

abstract.description: Optional. Defines the service abstract (or description) in the generated service metadata (capabilities) document

keywords.description: Optional. A comma-separated list of keywords that will appear in the service metadata (capabilities) document

indexData.description: Creates RTree files beside the shapefiles for optimized access

registerServiceInCatalog.description: Optional. Registers the service provider in Apollo catalog so that it appears in searches of the catalog

enableWFS.description: Enable/disable the WFS interface. The default value is true to enable

enableWMS.description: Enable/disable the WMS interface. The default value is true to enable

copyright.description: Optional. Defines text to appear in the upper left corner of each image generated by a GetMap request, and in the GML document produced by a GetFeature request

metadataURL.description: Optional. The URL template to metadata files that will appear in MetadataURL tags in the capabilities document. If not set, no MetadataURL will appear

allowStandardSRS.description: Enables standard SRSes (currently EPGS:4326) to be included in the capabilities document. The default value is true

publishedSRS.description: The list of srs to appear in the service metadata (capabilities) in addition to the srs parameter value

srsStrictBehavior.description: Allows only requests made in a SRS published in the capabilities even if it is able to do more. The default value is false

legendURL.description: Optional. The URL template to legend icons that will appear in LegendURL tags in the WMS service metadata (capabilities) document. A blank value uses the value of the <LEGEND> tag in the <CONFIGURATION> section

quality.description: Sets the quality of the PNG or JPEG image output by a WMS GetMap request

serviceMetadataURL.description: (Mandatory) Starting with OGC Web Services specifications versions WMS 1.3, WFS 1.1, WCS 1.1 and WTS 1.0 based on the OWS Common one, we use a single template for the ServiceIdentification and ServiceProvider sections of the service metadata (capabilities). This template is a flat file referenced by this parameter

otherMetadataURL.description: An URL (relative or not) to a file containing the ows extended capabilities of the operations metadata. The XML root should be ExtendedCapabilities elements and be a correct XML file

contactInfoDefinition.description: Holds a set of <PARAM> elements, which describe the contact information that will appear in the <Service> tag of the capabilities in the ContactInformation or ResponsibleParty sub-section

City.description: City part of the organization address

State.description: Administrative state part of the oranization address

Country.description: Country part of the organization address

PostCode.description: PostCode of the city part of the organization address

OnlineResource.description: The internet address of the organization web site

serviceMetadataDefinition.description: Holds a set of <PARAM> elements, which correspond to the content of the ServiceIdentification and ServiceProvider sections of the service metadata (capabilities document)

AdministrativeArea.description: Administrative state part of the organization address

City.description: City part of the organization address

Code.description: Service code (Leave blank in most cases)

ContactHours.description: The hours of service of the contact point

ContactInstructions.description: The instructions on how to reach contact point

ContactURL.description: The URL of the contact point

Country.description: Country part of the organization address

PostCode.description: PostCode of the city part of the organization address

ResponsibleRoleSpace.description: Code space of the role of the responsible person

Site.description: Internet address of the organization web site

Version.description: Supported versions (Leave blank in most cases)

czsGlobalDefinition.description: Global settings applied to all requests unless overridden by custom settings

clipMethod.description: Global clipping method for the provisioning job

extent.description: Global clipping extent for the provisioning job

outputSrs.description: Global Spatial Reference System for the output of the provisioning job

czsRequestDefinition.description: Properties specific request and override of global settings

outputSrs.description: The output spatial reference system. Original=use current epsg code of image. Global=use global epsg code settings.

clipMethod.description: The extent settings for clipping the image. Entire=use entire image extents. Global=user global extent settings. Custom=use extent property settings in this request

czsLasDefinition.description: Properties specific to clipping LAS data.

outputFormat.description: The output format of las data.

czsRasterDefinition.description: Properties specific to clipping raster data

outputFormat.description: The output format of raster data.

measurementXValue.description: Set x value based on measurementType

measurementYValue.description: Set y value based on measurementType

catalogLockPostPayloadParam.name: catalogLockPostPayload
catalogLockPostPayloadParam.description: Payload for specifying a set of items to be locked.

catalogUnlockPostPayloadParam.name: catalogUnlockPostPayload
catalogUnlockPostPayloadParam.description: Payload for specifying a lock set to unlock.

catalogItemIdPostPayloadParam.name: catalogItemIdPostPayload
catalogItemIdPostPayloadParam.description: Payload for specifying a single catalog id.

catalogItemIdsPostPayloadParam.name: catalogItemIdsPostPayload
catalogItemIdsPostPayloadParam.description: Payload for specifying multiple catalog ids.

profileParamFull.name: profile
profileParamFull.description: Profile determines the amount of detail that is returned with each catalog item.

profileParamBrief.name: profile
profileParamBrief.description: Profile determines the amount of detail that is returned with each catalog item.

keywordsParam.name: keywords
keywordsParam.description: Space separated set of keywords. This allows filtering of catalog items by specific keywords.

orderbyParam.name: orderby
orderbyParam.description: Return the catalog items ordered according to the given catalog property name. The property must be a valid property for the type of catalog item being queried. Use ```asc``` for ascending and ```desc``` for descending.

startParam.name: start
startParam.description: Filter the results starting at this index between 0 and the total number of catalog items.

maxresultsParam.name: maxresults
maxresultsParam.description: The maximum number of catalog items to return.

classesParam.name: classes
classesParam.description:
Comma delimited set of entity class names.  Possible values include:
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.ResourceAggregate```
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.imagery.ImageReference```
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.vector.VectorReference```
-  ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.pointcloud.PointCloudResource```
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.GenericItem```
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.video.VideoResource```

serviceClassesParam.name: classes
serviceClassesParam.description:
Comma delimited set of entity class names.  Possible values include:
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.ows.WebFeatureService```
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.ows.WebMapService```
- ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.ows.WebCoverageService```
-  ```com.erdas.rsp.babel.model.ows.WebProcessingService```

intersectParam.name: intersect
intersectParam.description: Spatially filtering using a spatial intersection with a WKT-encoded geometry.  Only valid for catalog item classes with a footprint.

deleteLocalFilesParam.name: deleteLocalFiles
deleteLocalFilesParam.description: Determines whether local files on server are deleted when provider is deleted.

attachmentNameParam.name: attachmentName
attachmentNameParam.description: Name of the catalog item attachment.

propertyNameParam.name: propertyName
propertyNameParam.description: Name of the catalog item property.

principalNameParam.name: principalName
principalNameParam.description: Principal name for a catalog item.

propertyPostPayloadParam.name: propertyPostPayload
propertyPostPayloadParam.description: Payload for creating or modifying a catalog item property.

catalogAttributePatchPayloadParam.name: catalogAttributePatchPay
catalogAttributePatchPayloadParam.description: Payload for modifying a catalog item property.

rightsPutPayloadParam.name: rightsPostPayload
rightsPutPayloadParam.description: Payload for updating principal's rights for a catalog  item property.

propertyPostTypeQueryParam.name: type
propertyPostTypeQueryParam.description:
Type code for catalog item property.
Type code defined as follows:
- ```'1' = string ```
- ```'2' = 32 bit integer ```
- ```'3' = double ```
- ```'4' = 64-bit integer ```
- ```'5' = float ```
- ```'6' = date (ISO-8601 format) ```

propertyPostValueQueryParam.name: value
propertyPostValueQueryParam.description: Value for the catalog item property. Must be url encoded.

propertyPostRenameQueryParam.name: rename
propertyPostRenameQueryParam.description: Rename query string parameter for catalog item properties.

attachmentPostPayload.name: addAttachment
attachmentPostPayload.description: Add a attachment that contains reference to file location and its mimeType
